intro: Tragacantha catacampta, commonly known as the Catacampta thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves, and it produces showy, orange-yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, similar to other members of its family. Tragacantha catacampta is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
